title: Kodi 18 Leia beta 4 released with one seriously killer new addons feature
description:
![Kodi 18
Leia](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg) Credit: Kodi Foundation

**The final build of Kodi 18 Leia is expected to be released by the end of the
year, but one of it’s best new features isn’t technically a new feature at
all.**

Kodi 18 Leia beta 4 is now available to download, and one of the biggest
changes in the new version is the removal of pre-installed binary [Kodi
addons](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/best-kodi-addons-2018-2993262)
from the install package.

For many users, this will make download Kodi a far less arduous process, as
the size of the file looks set to shrink dramatically. Instead, binary add-ons
– which are things like PVRs, screensavers, and visualisations – will be
housed in a central repository for you to install separately, just like some
of the other addons Kodi users might be familiar with.

Now that the Kodi software you download will just feature the basics, it also
means you don’t have to download an entire build just to refresh your binary
addons, as they can be updated independent of the larger platform.

> Important Kodi v18 notice: You need to install any PVR, Screensaver,
Visualisation, Image decoder or even certain file systems that you used before
from the Binary repo like any other addon.  
> Read here:<https://t.co/ctL4MxWnZ1>
[pic.twitter.com/3mEhv0cQOu](https://t.co/3mEhv0cQOu)

>

> — Kodi (@KodiTV) [October 24,
2018](https://twitter.com/KodiTV/status/1055086429968195584?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

The new binary repository is currently available for Kodi v18 Leia on Android,
macOS and Windows, and you can find Kodi downloads for all manner of operating
systems – including Android and iOS – [here.](https://kodi.tv/download) Note
that the iOS version retains pre-installed binary addons due to “platform
limitations”.

Alternatively, the full Kodi 18 Leia beta 4 change log is available to
[view](https://github.com/xbmc/xbmc/milestone/113?closed=1) on GitHub and
there’s a blog [post](https://kodi.tv/article/kodi-v18-leia-beta-4) on the
group’s website offering an overview of the key changes.
